member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.AddINS2ResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds tags to a resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to apply a tag to.
The tags to be added to a resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.AddINS2ResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.AddINS2ResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.AddINS2ResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.DisableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet
member.summary: Disables the Amazon Inspector delegated administrator for your organization.

para.para: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the current Amazon Inspector delegated administrator.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.DisableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DelegatedAdminAccountId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.DisableDelegatedAdminAccountResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Inspector2.Model.DisableDelegatedAdminAccountResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.DisableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DelegatedAdminAccountId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DelegatedAdminAccountId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.DisableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.EnableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet
member.summary: Enables the Amazon Inspector delegated administrator for your Organizations organization.

para.para: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the Amazon Inspector delegated administrator.
The idempotency token for the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.EnableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DelegatedAdminAccountId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.EnableDelegatedAdminAccountResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Inspector2.Model.EnableDelegatedAdminAccountResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.EnableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DelegatedAdminAccountId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DelegatedAdminAccountId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.EnableINS2DelegatedAdminAccountCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2AccountPermissionListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the permissions an account has to configure Amazon Inspector.

para.para: The service scan type to check permissions for.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

A token to use for paginating results that are returned in the response. Set the value of this parameter to null for the first request to a list action. For subsequent calls, use the NextToken value returned from the previous request to continue listing results after the first page.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2AccountPermissionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Permissions'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.ListAccountPermissionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Inspector2.Model.ListAccountPermissionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2AccountPermissionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Service parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Service' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2ConfigurationCmdlet
member.summary: Retrieves setting configurations for Inspector scans.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'EcrConfiguration'. member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2CoverageListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists coverage details for you environment.

para.para: An array of Amazon Web Services account IDs to return coverage statistics for.
The Amazon EC2 instance tags to filter on.
The Amazon ECR image tags to filter on.
The Amazon ECR repository name to filter on.
An array of Amazon Web Services resource IDs to return coverage statistics for.
An array of Amazon Web Services resource types to return coverage statistics for. The values can be AWS_EC2_INSTANCE or AWS_ECR_REPOSITORY.
The scan status code to filter on.
The scan status reason to filter on.
An array of Amazon Inspector scan types to return coverage statistics for.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

A token to use for paginating results that are returned in the response. Set the value of this parameter to null for the first request to a list action. For subsequent calls, use the NextToken value returned from the previous request to continue listing results after the first page.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.GetINS2FindingListCmdlet
member.summary: Lists findings for your environment.

para.para: Details of the Amazon Web Services account IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the component IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the component types used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance image IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance subnet IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance VPC IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon ECR image architecture types used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon ECR image hashes used to filter findings.
Details on the Amazon ECR image push date and time used to filter findings.
Details on the Amazon ECR registry used to filter findings.
Details on the name of the Amazon ECR repository used to filter findings.
The tags attached to the Amazon ECR container image.
The finding detail field by which results are sorted.
Details on the finding ARNs used to filter findings.
Details on the finding status types used to filter findings.
Details on the finding types used to filter findings.
Details on the date and time a finding was first seen used to filter findings.

Details on whether a fix is available through a version update. This value can be YES, NO, or PARTIAL. A PARTIAL fix means that some, but not all, of the packages identified in the finding have fixes available through updated versions.
The Amazon Inspector score to filter on.
Details on the date and time a finding was last seen used to filter findings.
Details on the ingress source addresses used to filter findings.
Details on the port ranges used to filter findings.
Details on the related vulnerabilities used to filter findings.
Details on the resource IDs used to filter findings.
Details on the resource tags used to filter findings.
Details on the resource types used to filter findings.
Details on the severity used to filter findings.
The order by which findings are sorted.
Details on the finding title used to filter findings.
Details on the date and time a finding was last updated at used to filter findings.
Details on the vendor severity used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerability ID used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerability type used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerable packages used to filter findings.
The maximum number of results to return in the response.

A token to use for paginating results that are returned in the response. Set the value of this parameter to null for the first request to a list action. For subsequent calls, use the NextToken value returned from the previous request to continue listing results after the first page.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.NewINS2FilterCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a filter resource using specified filter criteria.

para.para: Defines the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.
Details of the Amazon Web Services account IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the component IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the component types used to filter findings.
A description of the filter.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance image IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance subnet IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon EC2 instance VPC IDs used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon ECR image architecture types used to filter findings.
Details of the Amazon ECR image hashes used to filter findings.
Details on the Amazon ECR image push date and time used to filter findings.
Details on the Amazon ECR registry used to filter findings.
Details on the name of the Amazon ECR repository used to filter findings.
The tags attached to the Amazon ECR container image.
Details on the finding ARNs used to filter findings.
Details on the finding status types used to filter findings.
Details on the finding types used to filter findings.
Details on the date and time a finding was first seen used to filter findings.

Details on whether a fix is available through a version update. This value can be YES, NO, or PARTIAL. A PARTIAL fix means that some, but not all, of the packages identified in the finding have fixes available through updated versions.
The Amazon Inspector score to filter on.
Details on the date and time a finding was last seen used to filter findings.
The name of the filter. Minimum length of 3. Maximum length of 64. Valid characters include alphanumeric characters, dot (.), underscore (_), and dash (-). Spaces are not allowed.
Details on the ingress source addresses used to filter findings.
Details on the port ranges used to filter findings.
The reason for creating the filter.
Details on the related vulnerabilities used to filter findings.
Details on the resource IDs used to filter findings.
Details on the resource tags used to filter findings.
Details on the resource types used to filter findings.
Details on the severity used to filter findings.
A list of tags for the filter.
Details on the finding title used to filter findings.
Details on the date and time a finding was last updated at used to filter findings.
Details on the vendor severity used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerability ID used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerability type used to filter findings.
Details on the vulnerable packages used to filter findings.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.UpdateINS2ConfigurationCmdlet
member.summary: Updates setting configurations for your Amazon Inspector account. When you use this API as an Amazon Inspector delegated administrator this updates the setting for all accounts you manage. Member accounts in an organization cannot update this setting.

para.para: The ECR automated re-scan duration defines how long an ECR image will be actively scanned by Amazon Inspector. When the number of days since an image was last pushed exceeds the automated re-scan duration the monitoring state of that image becomes inactive and all associated findings are scheduled for closure.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.UpdateINS2ConfigurationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Inspector2.Model.UpdateConfigurationResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the EcrConfiguration_RescanDuration parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^EcrConfiguration_RescanDuration' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.INS2.UpdateINS2ConfigurationCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
